blocks.text: Indexing improves query performance by allowing the database to find rows faster, similar to the index of a book.

list: B-Tree Index: Balanced tree structure for fast search, insert, delete
Hash Index: Fast exact-match lookups using hash functions
Composite Index: Index on multiple columns for complex queries
Full-Text Index: Efficient search on text fields

list: Indexes speed up SELECT but slow down INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE
Use indexes selectively on frequently queried columns
Monitor index usage and remove unused indexes to save space
Combine indexes with query optimization for best performance

blocks.title: Real World Tip
blocks.text: Large-scale databases (millions of rows) rely heavily on indexing. Poor indexing can make queries take minutes instead of milliseconds.
